Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in finding the Applicant did not meet the residency requirement under section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant must accumulate at least 1,095 days of residence in Canada over four years; 'centralized mode of existence' test from Re Koo applies
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed due to significant factual errors and misapplication of the residency test
Remedy_Requested: Redetermination of residency compliance by another Citizenship Judge
Court_Ruling: The appeal is allowed; case referred back for redetermination
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged non-compliance with residency requirements for citizenship
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard in reviewing Citizenship Judge's decision
Assessment_Factor: Residency duration, centralized mode of existence, connection to Canada vs. other countries
Evidence_Used: Residency records, travel history, evidence of ties to Canada and other countries
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act, Re Koo test
Application_Basis: Factual determination of residency and application of legal test
Evidence_Assessed: Day counts, interpretation of evidence on residency, comparative connections to countries
Relief_Sought: Grant of citizenship upon proper assessment of residency
Governing_Rule: Re Koo's 'centralized mode of existence' test
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Incorrect day counts, misinterpretation of evidence, failure to compare international connections
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged denial of citizenship based on alleged non-compliance with residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Errors in calculation and interpretation of residency evidence
Evidence_Issues: Inaccurate day count, misinterpretation, incomplete comparative analysis
Residency_Compliance: Failure to properly assess 1,095-day requirement and centered life in Canada
Evidence_Assessment: Flawed evaluation of applicantâ€™s residency and ties
Decision_Rationale: Significant factual errors and misapplication of the Re Koo test
Evidentiary_Issues: Incorrect calculations, failure to consider all relevant evidence
